claim:
Taken together, our data demonstrate the importance of rapidly and openly sharing science in the context of a global pandemic and the essential role of preprints in this endeavour.Results
COVID-19 preprints were posted early in the pandemic and represent a significant proportion of the COVID-19 literature
The COVID-19 pandemic has rapidly spread across the globe, from 3 patients in the city of Wuhan on the December 27, 2019 to over 46.1 million confirmed cases worldwide by the end of October 2020 (Fig 1A).
